# OpenVidu

> From ready-to-use video conferencing apps<br>to custom-made WebRTC solutions.<br>Self-hosted. Performant. Scalable. Fault tolerant. Observable.

Self-hosted videoconference solution and SDK

## OpenVidu

- [Home](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/index.md): OpenVidu - Ready to use self-hosted videoconferencing solutions and SDKs
- [Pricing](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/pricing/index.md): Pricing models for OpenVidu Meet and OpenVidu Platform
- [OpenVidu Meet vs OpenVidu Platform](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/openvidu-meet-vs-openvidu-platform/index.md): What to choose, OpenVidu Meet or OpenVidu Platform?

## OpenVidu Meet [BETA]

- [OpenVidu Meet](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Ready to use videoconferencing solution
- [Getting started with OpenVidu Meet](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/getting-started/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Getting started
- [Rooms and meetings](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/features/rooms-and-meetings/index.md): OpenVidu Meet Features - How to use rooms and meetings
- [Recordings](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/features/recordings/index.md): OpenVidu Meet Features - Managing recordings
- [Users and permissions](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/features/users-and-permissions/index.md): OpenVidu Meet Features - How to manage users and permissions
- [Overview](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/deployment/overview/index.md): A comparison of different deployment models for OpenVidu Meet
- [Try OpenVidu Meet locally](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/deployment/local/index.md): How to deploy OpenVidu Meet locally for testing and development purposes
- [Basic deployment](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/deployment/basic/index.md): How to deploy OpenVidu Meet on-premises within a single server for production use
- [Advanced deployments](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/deployment/advanced/index.md): How to deploy OpenVidu Meet on multiple servers with scalability and fault-tolerance for production use
- [Introduction](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/intro/index.md): How to embed OpenVidu Meet in my own application with a single line of HTML
- [Step by step guide](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/step-by-step-guide/index.md): A step by step guide on how to embed OpenVidu Meet on your own applications
- [Direct Link](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/tutorials/direct-link/index.md): An OpenVidu Meet tutorial for embedding OpenVidu Meet on a Node.js applications using a direct link. It uses Node.js and Express for the backend and plain HTML/CSS/JavaScript for the frontend.
- [WebComponent](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/tutorials/webcomponent/index.md): An OpenVidu Meet tutorial for embedding OpenVidu Meet the OpenVidu Meet WebComponent. It uses Node.js and Express for the backend and plain HTML/CSS/JavaScript for the frontend.
- [WebComponent Commands & Events](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/tutorials/webcomponent-advanced/index.md): An OpenVidu Meet WebComponent tutorial demonstrating how to use the OpenVidu Meet Component programmatically and respond to meeting events. It includes usage of features of OpenVidu Meet such as WebComponent commands, event handling, role-based UI, meeting header, and enhanced room management.
- [Recordings](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/tutorials/recordings/index.md): How to add recording management capabilities to an OpenVidu Meet WebComponent application. It includes listing recordings, viewing recordings and deleting recordings.
- [Webhooks](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/tutorials/webhooks/index.md): Learn how to build a real-time video conferencing application using Node.js and JavaScript with live updates through webhooks and Server-Sent Events.
- [Direct Link](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/reference/direct-link/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Reference documentation
- [Iframe](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/reference/iframe/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Reference documentation
- [REST API](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/reference/rest-api/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Reference documentation
- [Webcomponent](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/reference/webcomponent/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Reference documentation
- [Webhooks](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/meet/embedded/reference/webhooks/index.md): OpenVidu Meet - Reference documentation

## OpenVidu Platform

- [OpenVidu Platform](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/index.md): OpenVidu Platform - Self-hosted SDK to build scalable videoconferencing solutions
- [Getting started](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/getting-started/index.md): OpenVidu Platform - Getting started
- [Comparing OpenVidu](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/comparing-openvidu/index.md): OpenVidu Platform - Comparing OpenVidu Meet and OpenVidu Platform with other solutions like LiveKit Cloud and Mediasoup
- [Developing your OpenVidu app](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/developing-your-openvidu-app/index.md): OpenVidu Platform - Steps involved in building an OpenVidu videoconferencing application.
- [How to](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/developing-your-openvidu-app/how-to/index.md): OpenVidu Platform - Quick reference of the most common operations you may want to perform in your application while integrating OpenVidu Platform.
- [Advanced Features Tutorials](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/tutorials/advanced-features/index.md): Explore more advanced features of LiveKit with our tutorials on recording, S3, Azure, and more.
- [AI Services Tutorials](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/tutorials/ai-services/index.md): Learn how to integrate AI services in your OpenVidu applications.
- [Angular Components Tutorials](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/tutorials/angular-components/index.md): Learn how to customize your application UI with Angular Components tutorials. Custom layouts, toolbars, panels, chat and more.
- [Application Client Tutorials](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/tutorials/application-client/index.md): Learn how to build a LiveKit application client to connect to a room, publish media and subscribe to media from other participants.
- [Application Server Tutorials](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/tutorials/application-server/index.md): Learn how to build an application server that generates LiveKit tokens and receives webhook events.
- [Deployment types](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/deployment-types/index.md): Description of the different OpenVidu Platform user-friendly installers that facilitate quick on-premises deployments, so you can self-host your real-time solution in your own infrastructure or any cloud provider.
- [Local (Development)](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/local/index.md): Easy local install deployment instructions for testing and development purposes.
- [OpenVidu Single Node Community](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/single-node/index.md): Different options for a single node deployment, be it on-premises or on any of the most popular cloud providers such as AWS, Azure or GCP.
- [OpenVidu Single Node Pro](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/single-node-pro/index.md): The features of Single Node OpenVidu with a 2x performance and advanced observability.
- [OpenVidu Elastic](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/elastic/index.md): Elastic deployment options for OpenVidu Platform, either on-premises, on AWS, or on Azure.
- [OpenVidu High Availability](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/ha/index.md): High Availability deployment options for OpenVidu Platform, either on-premises (with DNS or network load balancers), on AWS, or on Azure.
- [Production ready](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/index.md): Main advantages of self-hosting videoconferencing and live-streaming solutions with OpenVidu Platform, which are privacy, leverage your resources, performant, scalable, fault tolerant, and observable.
- [Performant](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/performance/index.md): OpenVidu Platform 2x performance by using mediasoup to replace the original Pion LiveKit WebRTC engine while maintaining the LiveKit API.
- [Scalable](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/scalability/index.md): OpenVidu Platform scalability numbers and Elastic and High Availability deployments.
- [Fault Tolerant](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/fault-tolerance/index.md): OpenVidu is designed from the ground up to be fault tolerant in all its services in case of node downtime, especially in its High Availability deployment.
- [Observability](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/observability/index.md): A description of OpenVidu's observability toolset to monitor and analyze your deployment in real-time, consisting on OpenVidu Dashboard and a Grafana stack.
- [OpenVidu Dashboard](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/observability/openvidu-dashboard/index.md): How to access real-time video room statistics and monitoring with OpenVidu Dashboard. Track rooms, participants, egresses and ingresses.
- [Grafana Stack](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/production-ready/observability/grafana-stack/index.md): How to use OpenVidu's built-in Grafana dashboards to monitor different metrics from OpenVidu Platform and logs from your cluster.
- [How To Guides](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/self-hosting/how-to-guides/index.md): Explore step-by-step guides to customize your OpenVidu deployment for specific use cases.
- [Overview](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/ai/overview/index.md): OpenVidu offers a catalog of AI services that can be easily integrated into your application to enhance the user experience and add advanced features. These services are provided by OpenVidu agents, a set of pre-configured and ready-to-use AI modules.
- [Overview](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/ai/openvidu-agents/overview/index.md): A description of how to use and configure OpenVidu Agents, pre-configured and ready-to-use AI modules.
- [Speech Processing agent](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/ai/openvidu-agents/speech-processing-agent/index.md): Instructions on how to configure the Speech Processing OpenVidu agent which transcribes audio speech to text in real time.
- [Angular Components](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/ui-components/angular-components/index.md): OpenVidu Angular Components simplify the creation of videoconferencing apps, offering customizable and powerful components for rapid development and easy maintenance. This is a how-to guide on using this angular library.
- [React Components](https://openvidu.io/3.4.1/docs/ui-components/react-components/index.md): the simplest way to create real-time audio/video applications with React.
